conclusion: Use the first law of thermodynamics: ΔU = Q - W.
Identify given data: Temperature at state A is 200 K, ΔU is 200 J, process involves A to B (isobaric) and B to C (isochoric).
From the diagram: P = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3, V_B = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Calculate work done from A to B: W_AB = P (V_B - V_A) = 900 J.
Calculate work done from B to C: W_BC = 0 J (since volume is constant).
Total work done: W = W_AB + W_BC = 900 J.
Apply the first law of thermodynamics: Q = ΔU + W.
Substitute known values: Q = 200 J + 900 J = 1100 J.
The heat Q exchanged between the gas and the environment is 1100 J.
